file_content.text: Never seen so many aliens in one place my whole life. Coruscant is one strange planet.
I'm bringing Darmas up to speed while we travel. Save us time when we get to him.
Everything on Coruscant is huge. You see those city towers as we flew in? How many people you figure live in those? Millions?
You've never been off Ord Mantell in your life, have you?
You're such a farm boy, Corso.
Don't go making assumptions. I've just never been here.
Looks like some of the city towers lost a few levels.
Coruscant's seen better days.
Heard the Sith Empire hit this planet pretty hard. Even knocked the Jedi Temple off its pedestal.
Let's go find Skavak and disintegrate him.
We're not here on vacation.
Whoa--slow down, Captain. This planet must have a trillion people on it.
Wanna find Skavak before we're too old to shoot straight? We're gonna need local help.
We'll just rattle some skulls until Skavak falls out.
Finding him will be easy.
Wouldn't mind getting some practice with Sparky here, but I know a faster way.
Got someone particular in mind?
I don't know anybody here.
I happen to know the perfect guy.
I can handle this myself. I don't even need you.
Forget help, and forget you.
Don't be like that, Captain. I'm trying to save you some time and trouble.
I'm in this, too, all right? Viidu was a friend of mine. Skavak needs to pay for what happened to him.
There's a gambler named Darmas Pollaran who keeps tabs on everything worth knowing about Coruscant. Good man. You'll like him.
Worth a visit, I guess. Where do I find this Darmas?
If you say so.
Viidu always said if you look for a sabacc table surrounded by beautiful women, you'll find Darmas, but I can narrow that down.
What does Darmas do?
Viidu called him an "information broker." When Darmas isn't playing sabacc, he buys and sells the kind of answers we need.
I'm not in the mood to sit around playing cards.
I don't gamble.
Don't have to. Just talk to him. If he can't point us toward Skavak, he'll know somebody who can.
I still have Viidu's holofrequency contacts, and Darmas is one of them. Give me a second, and we'll talk to the man himself....
Corso, is that you? It's been too long, you rascal. What brings you to Coruscant?
A friend and I are in a real bind. Is there a place we can meet you?
Of course. Come to my private cantina booth. I'm here now, winning my tenth hand of sabacc against a very persistent Rodian.
Hope you don't mind the occasional blaster fire; the cantina's in a rowdy part of Coruscant.
I just came from a war zone. I'm used to blaster fire.
Won't bother me.
Had a feeling you were more than a tourist.
See you soon.
I look forward to meeting you in person. I expect it will brighten my day considerably.
Well, this sounds urgent. I can't wait to hear the details.
Sounds like my kind of place.
I love a good cantina.
I hope that's only the first of many affinities we share.
Do you know how to play sabacc? If not, I'll teach you. It's the favorite game around here.
Keep your comlink channel open, Darmas. I've got some bad news about Viidu.
I'll bring Darmas up to speed while we travel, Captain.
Don't tell Darmas anything he doesn't need to know.
Be discreet.
Keep your eyes open for that scum-sucker who stole my ship.
Watch out for Skavak.
Stick with me or I'll leave you behind.
Try to keep up.
You got it.
I don't have any spare credits, all right? Wish I could help you.
Coruscant Security + Customs Enforcement Division = welcomes you, gentlebeing!
Error // Identification protocols + past cargo logs = contradictory // Request = please hold for customs enforcement agent!
Identification protocols = accepted! // Coruscant Security + Customs Enforcement Division = welcomes you, Admiral Numinn! // Request = have a pleasant stay!
